posts.name: Ajmal
posts.cooked: As a user, I would love to have the ability to have more than 4 pinned chats. This nummber should be flexible. Not sure why there is a limit here.
The limit is there to accommodate for all screen sizes. 4 to 6 I’d say is a good middle ground. If you can just pin unlimited chats then you’ll never see new threads from the top of the view.
Personally, I wouldn’t mind new messages appearing off-screen. I’d love to be able to pin an unlimited amount of conversations.

posts.name: Cameron Brill
posts.cooked: Maybe instead of restricting number of pinned chats, we can have a warning once you’re taking up 2/3 of the screen saying something like “WARNING: Pinning anymore groups will hide new messages from unpinned chats.”
I agree. Some flexibility in the limit would be useful. Why not leave it to the user to decide?
I’d also like to have more than 4 pins. Can’t even add my family there, as I don’t have enough spots. I think the users should them self be able to decide how many conversations to pin.

posts.name: Phil
posts.cooked:
Why is it limited to 4?
Cheers

posts.name: Brochard
posts.cooked: It’s limited to 4 because it’s displayed vertically, that’s why I proposed an horizontal design here

Hi all,

from my point of view more than 4 pins are beneficial. Of course it is clear the a too big list is not what the pins are for (when considering the arguments above). But we moved quite a lot of groups from whatsapp to signal and being able to pin more groups would be very useful to access the top priority groups first.
Also since more and more people are moving to signal the importance of more pins increases from my point of view.

Also the argument with the “new messages from unpinned chats” is only true if you don’t notice the number of new conversation or the notifications are not shown.

History:
The feature was discussed first in Pin conversation to the top where it was mentioned that you would not pin more than 3 or 4 conversations.

Also increasing this number seems not to be too hard on the first glance, only this magic number has to be increased (I currently don’t know whether any test cases will fail if this is changed, this has to be evaluated additionally).

Such numbers should clearly be something that the user can set in their client and not something that is hardcoded but Signal has all sorts of issues with it.

newuser:

Such numbers should clearly be something that the user can set in their client and not something that is hardcoded

Should they though? There must be some reason that there is a limit. WhatsApp only allows 3 chats to be pinned, though Telegram allows 5.
What could be the reason? If someone fills up their screen with pinned chats and has to scroll to see others, that is their problem to solve.
My guess would be that keeping things tight enforces that features are used as intended, with the idea that it yields fewer support requests.

TeeJay82:

keeping things tight enforces that features are used as intended, with the idea that it yields fewer support requests.

That’s the only thing I can think of, because there shouldn’t be any technical limitations. Without a limit you’ll inevitably end up with people who pin all their chats and then complain to support about the chats not sorting properly.

I really like this idea for groups and pinned chats. Frees up some space and can easily scroll horizontally. That horizontal scrolling is a user experience that has been normalized by social media apps, so most users would likely be at home with it.
I don’t pin chats, but doesn’t the horizontal way sort of defeat the purpose? You’ll have most of the pinned chats hidden until you start scrolling.

I look at it a little bit differently; with 4 pinned chats at the top as it is today, there are X pixels reserved for pinned chats. Its about 1/3 the of the vertical screen space on my device.

Using the horizontal setup, that would allow for 8 pinned chats (maybe more if the same size icons are used) in the same (or less) physical space before any scrolling is necessary.

Additionally, since it would be horizontal scrolling instead of vertical, the rest of the unpinned chats will still sort most recent at the top.

My use of pinned chats is so I can quickly find and send a message to the contacts I contact most frequently, so losing the sort (most recent bubbling to the top) for those pinned chats isn’t a big deal to me.
I don’t really understand the plus value to add more than 4. When you have a frequents conversations, it automatically moves to the top. So why do you want to have more than 4 not so used chats ?

I strongly support this, too.
There are definitely chats that are more important than others. I’d really love to pin the 10 or 20 most important conversations to the top and not even see other (muted) groups for instance. That would make using Signal much much nicer.

This is a needed feature. Just created an account to beg! :) In the absence of functional labelling or tagging, being able pin is a way of organizing an otherwise cluttered UI:

  • keeping important contacts (family members, friends, colleagues, employees) sorted & grouped together
  • separating group chats from one-on-one chats
  • quickly distinguishing certain group chats from others
  • using pinned chats as a reminder; i.e. pinning chats that need a reply, or pinning chats in which you’re awaiting a response

There are a million more reasons this would be a useful feature.

If people want to pin more than 4 chats, they have a good reason. If increased support request volume is a concern, just add a warning notification when passing 4 pins.

For anyone communicating on Signal at scale, ie orgs or enterprise, this is desperately needed.
